messages.message: Not yet. I wanted to fix the cypress tests first.
Could we migrate it first? A couple tests are failing in the sandbox, but we can't fix it properly because they pass on Crafting Cypress
What user are you using to test it?
We are creating new users when running crafting cypress tests. The problem is that the UI is different in sandbox (migrated) and crafting cypress (not yet migrated)
Ok. Then we should be able to unblock you by flipping the feature flag.
ty!!
Feature flag has been flipped.
perfect! Thank you!

Ahh, is it ok to flip the feature flag without migrating users? I'm seeing error toasts with `Metronome customer for support-testing.cypress.drives_instabase.com (http://drives_instabase.com) not found` errors on Crafting Cypress now...
Let me check if the script has finished.
@Victor Zeng any updates on this? This blocks all frontend engs from using Cypress to validate their changes. Would be great to get this done asap :woman-bowing:

the cypress CI run  (https://cloud.cypress.io/projects/cfhedy/runs/14243/overview/b915eb12-83af-4cfa-a7bc-c7fd234b9d4b/replay?roarHideRunsWithDiffGroupsAndTags=1&runStatus=PASSED&runStatus=FAILED&runStatus=RUNNING&runStatus=CANCELLED&runStatus=ERRORED&runStatus=NOTESTS&runStatus=TIMEDOUT&ts=1727385984514.1&att=1)on my PR failed bc of this - this is expected, right? all cypress CI runs will fail until this is fixed?
2000/3000 accounts are migrated.
There's about 1000 accounts left.

@Victor Zeng @Weiming Wu I see the same issue on sandbox (https://aihub-sandbox.internal.instabase.com/settings/account) when I log in as a newly created user.
Test account: <mailto:cy-account-user-1727382225563@instabase.com|cy-account-user-1727382225563@instabase.com> / ChangeMe123!
I just realized this, but did we mock out the trial-license API call?
What do you mean by mock out? It has been calling the actual endpoint for a long time
I tried out creating a new account on sandbox, and it works as expected.
Yea, same. Probably need to update our script to create new community users & set up their license?
It should set up their license on their first login

https://cloud.cypress.io/projects/cfhedy/runs/14241/overview/45dcc2d7-0b05-49cb-833d-[â€¦]rHideRunsWithDiffGroupsAndTags=1&ts=1727381592044.0999&att=1 (https://cloud.cypress.io/projects/cfhedy/runs/14241/overview/45dcc2d7-0b05-49cb-833d-f21e40caf9d7/replay?roarHideRunsWithDiffGroupsAndTags=1&ts=1727381592044.0999&att=1)

From the log, I can see that when we log in as a newly created user:
1. we initialize the license with `api/v2/licenses/trial-license/ai-hub` (IB-Context: cy-landing-user-1727381467211_instabase.com (http://cy-landing-user-1727381467211_instabase.com)), which returns 201
2. try to get their spend limit by calling: `api/v2/licenses/spend-limit/cy-landing-user-1727381467211_instabase.com` and the response is 
```{
  "message": "Metronome customer for cy-landing-user-1727381467211_instabase.com (http://cy-landing-user-1727381467211_instabase.com) not found"
}```

Ok. I can reproduce by adding a non-existing user to an org and then remove. Log in as that new user via forgot password flow.
<mailto:xindi.xu+0926add-and-remove@instabase.com|xindi.xu+0926add-and-remove@instabase.com> / ChangeMe123!

This is how we create new community users in Cypress
As an immediate workaround, I'll mock out the `spend-limit` endpoint so suppress this error.
Yep. Checked the account integrations.
They're both null.
For community, stripe and metronome accounts are created upon email verification. Do we skip email verification during cypress?
yes, we manually set it to true via api calls.
In that case, you'll want to call the `{{base_url}}/api/v2/licenses/migrate` endpoint with site-admin credentials.
This will create the accounts in metronome and stripe.
(Ideally we would call the endpoint to activate the email instead)

Hm, init upon email verification seems incorrect to me.
I added a new user to the org, log in as that new user, and then switched to the community context. (note that no email verification is needed because the user already verified their email when they accepted the org invite). I do see the modal for license creation, but the usage page is not loading for me and I see this in the network tab
```"Metronome customer for xindi.xu.0926test3_instabase.com not found"```
I don't see the error toast tho.
Edit: see it now when I switch to the subscription page
<mailto:xindi.xu+0926test3@instabase.com|xindi.xu+0926test3@instabase.com>/ChangeMe123!

Now I also got this error :lolcry: when I try to migrate license....
`"500 Internal Server Error: The server encountered an internal error and was unable to complete your request. Either the server is overloaded or there is an error in the application`
Just discussed this with Victor but init-upon-email-verification might miss users signing up via Google auth too, which is a big deal.

If I move the metronome account creation here, this should cover everything, right? https://github.com/instabase/instabase/blob/9df66014d7f272b431361de0b86cc0b2f2c40c[â€¦]bserver/webapp/src/py/instabase/webapp/handler/views/account.py (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/blob/9df66014d7f272b431361de0b86cc0b2f2c40c6a/webserver/webapp/src/py/instabase/webapp/handler/views/account.py#L143)
Yea, this should work
Another place to do this would be in the endpoint to init trial licenses `api/v2/licenses/trial-license/ai-hub`
If we do it in `setup_after_user_creation`, is there is a risk of creating metronome/stripe accounts for users who never complete email verification (i.e. users who ghost us)?
Yea, I think `api/v2/licenses/trial-license/ai-hub` is a better place. We only init the license after user log in for the exact reason

Cypress license issue update:
Tests using newly created community users won't work for now.
1. We caught a backend bug. We shouldn't complete setting up the license in the verify email step. Google auth users, org users, users created in Cypress won't go thru this step. We should move it to the create license endpoint, which is called upon the first login + in Cypress script
2. With this fix, the Cypress pipeline using new community users should work
3. I put up a PR (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/63170) to for a temp fix by calling the migrate license endpoint. 
My PR won't resolve the issue for existing PRs. We'll need to manually call `api/v2/licenses/migrate` endpoint to migrate the license.
PR here: https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/63172
i force-merged Xindiâ€™s PR (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/63170)! so Cypress CI should be unblocked for at least new PRs now
@mfichman can you approve this tomorrow when you get on?
